alert.note: Alert for Lake; Mendocino (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 09 at 2:33AM PST until further notice by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM PST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of central California and northwest California, including the following counties, in central California, Lake. In northwest California, Mendocino. * WHEN...Until 800 AM PST. * IMPACTS...Heavy rainfall will increase the risk of rock and mud slides. Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 231 AM PST, local law enforcement reported several small rock and mud slides in Lake County. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Ukiah, Lakeport, Point Arena, Upper Lake, Ukiah Municipal Airport, Middletown, Clearlake, Knobcone Camp, Hopland, Finley, North Lakeport, Saratoga Springs, Witter Springs, Soda Bay, Mount Konocti, Glenhaven, Konocti Bay, Loch Lomond, Adams and Hobergs. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
